page.title: 08NEW DEVELOPMENTS.HOUSING
page.content: On the surface life in the valley of the Gwaun has hardly changed in the last 50 years.The countryside is totally unspoilt with very little sign of new developments.New houses are a rarity in an area protected by the National Park.What new houses that are built are associated in the main with agriculture.They are usually bungalows which are designed to look like the existing buildings found in the valley.The two main reasons for allowing new developments are for the housing of agricultural staff, such as cowmen,and when farmers retire they often move out of the farmhouse to let a son take over.
